Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of this software and/or associated documentation files (the "Materials"), to deal in the Materials without restriction, including without limitation the rights to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of the Materials, and to permit persons to whom the Materials are furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:
The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all copies or substantial portions of the Materials.
THE MATERIALS ARE PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE MATERIALS OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE MATERIALS.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
This file, vk.xml, is the Vulkan API Registry. It is a critically important and normative part of the Vulkan Specification, including a canonical machine-readable definition of the API, parameter and member validation language incorporated into the Specification and reference pages, and other material which is registered by Khronos, such as tags used by extension and layer authors. The only authoritative version of vk.xml is the one maintained in the master branch of the Khronos Vulkan GitHub project.

vendorid.name: KHR
vendorid.comment: This is the next available Khronos vendor ID

types.type: // DEPRECATED: This define has been removed. Specific version defines (e.g. VK_API_VERSION_1_0), or the VK_MAKE_VERSION macro, should be used instead. //#define VK_API_VERSION VK_MAKE_VERSION(1, 0, 0)

#if !defined(VK_DEFINE_NON_DISPATCHABLE_HANDLE) #if defined(__LP64__) || defined(_WIN64) || (defined(__x86_64__) && !defined(__ILP32__) ) || defined(_M_X64) || defined(__ia64) || defined (_M_IA64) || defined(__aarch64__) || defined(__powerpc64__) #define VK_DEFINE_NON_DISPATCHABLE_HANDLE(object) typedef struct object##_T *object; #else #define VK_DEFINE_NON_DISPATCHABLE_HANDLE(object) typedef uint64_t object; #endif #endif
typedef void (VKAPI_PTR *PFN_vkInternalAllocationNotification)( void* pUserData, size_t size, VkInternalAllocationType allocationType, VkSystemAllocationScope allocationScope);
typedef void (VKAPI_PTR *PFN_vkInternalFreeNotification)( void* pUserData, size_t size, VkInternalAllocationType allocationType, VkSystemAllocationScope allocationScope);
typedef void* (VKAPI_PTR *PFN_vkReallocationFunction)( void* pUserData, void* pOriginal, size_t size, size_t alignment, VkSystemAllocationScope allocationScope);
typedef void* (VKAPI_PTR *PFN_vkAllocationFunction)( void* pUserData, size_t size, size_t alignment, VkSystemAllocationScope allocationScope);

type.name: VkClearColorValue
type.comment: // Union allowing specification of floating point, integer, or unsigned integer color data. Actual value selected is based on image/attachment being cleared.

type.name: VkClearValue
type.comment: // Union allowing specification of color or depth and stencil values. Actual value selected is based on attachment being cleared.

enums.name: API Constants
enums.comment: Misc. hardcoded constants - not an enumerated type

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_LAYOUT_UNDEFINED
enum.comment: Implicit layout an image is when its contents are undefined due to various reasons (e.g. right after creation)

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_LAYOUT_GENERAL
enum.comment: General layout when image can be used for any kind of access

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_LAYOUT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_OPTIMAL
enum.comment: Optimal layout when image is only used for color attachment read/write

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_LAYOUT_DEPTH_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT_OPTIMAL
enum.comment: Optimal layout when image is only used for depth/stencil attachment read/write

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_LAYOUT_DEPTH_STENCIL_READ_ONLY_OPTIMAL
enum.comment: Optimal layout when image is used for read only depth/stencil attachment and shader access

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_LAYOUT_SHADER_READ_ONLY_OPTIMAL
enum.comment: Optimal layout when image is used for read only shader access

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_LAYOUT_TRANSFER_SRC_OPTIMAL
enum.comment: Optimal layout when image is used only as source of transfer operations

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_LAYOUT_TRANSFER_DST_OPTIMAL
enum.comment: Optimal layout when image is used only as destination of transfer operations

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_LAYOUT_PREINITIALIZED
enum.comment: Initial layout used when the data is populated by the CPU

enum.name: VK_SAMPLER_MIPMAP_MODE_NEAREST
enum.comment: Choose nearest mip level

enum.name: VK_SAMPLER_MIPMAP_MODE_LINEAR
enum.comment: Linear filter between mip levels

enum.name: VK_SUCCESS
enum.comment: Command completed successfully

enum.name: VK_NOT_READY
enum.comment: A fence or query has not yet completed

enum.name: VK_TIMEOUT
enum.comment: A wait operation has not completed in the specified time

enum.name: VK_EVENT_SET
enum.comment: An event is signaled

enum.name: VK_EVENT_RESET
enum.comment: An event is unsignaled

enum.name: VK_INCOMPLETE
enum.comment: A return array was too small for the result

enum.name: VK_ERROR_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY
enum.comment: A host memory allocation has failed

enum.name: VK_ERROR_OUT_OF_DEVICE_MEMORY
enum.comment: A device memory allocation has failed

enum.name: VK_ERROR_INITIALIZATION_FAILED
enum.comment: Initialization of a object has failed

enum.name: VK_ERROR_DEVICE_LOST
enum.comment: The logical device has been lost. See <<devsandqueues-lost-device>>

enum.name: VK_ERROR_MEMORY_MAP_FAILED
enum.comment: Mapping of a memory object has failed

enum.name: VK_ERROR_LAYER_NOT_PRESENT
enum.comment: Layer specified does not exist

enum.name: VK_ERROR_EXTENSION_NOT_PRESENT
enum.comment: Extension specified does not exist

enum.name: VK_ERROR_FEATURE_NOT_PRESENT
enum.comment: Requested feature is not available on this device

enum.name: VK_ERROR_INCOMPATIBLE_DRIVER
enum.comment: Unable to find a Vulkan driver

enum.name: VK_ERROR_TOO_MANY_OBJECTS
enum.comment: Too many objects of the type have already been created

enum.name: VK_ERROR_FORMAT_NOT_SUPPORTED
enum.comment: Requested format is not supported on this device

enum.name: VK_ERROR_FRAGMENTED_POOL
enum.comment: A requested pool allocation has failed due to fragmentation of the pool's memory

enum.name: VK_QUEUE_GRAPHICS_BIT
enum.comment: Queue supports graphics operations

enum.name: VK_QUEUE_COMPUTE_BIT
enum.comment: Queue supports compute operations

enum.name: VK_QUEUE_TRANSFER_BIT
enum.comment: Queue supports transfer operations

enum.name: VK_QUEUE_SPARSE_BINDING_BIT
enum.comment: Queue supports sparse resource memory management operations

enum.name: VK_MEMORY_PROPERTY_DEVICE_LOCAL_BIT
enum.comment: If otherwise stated, then allocate memory on device

enum.name: VK_MEMORY_PROPERTY_HOST_VISIBLE_BIT
enum.comment: Memory is mappable by host

enum.name: VK_MEMORY_PROPERTY_HOST_COHERENT_BIT
enum.comment: Memory will have i/o coherency. If not set, application may need to use vkFlushMappedMemoryRanges and vkInvalidateMappedMemoryRanges to flush/invalidate host cache

enum.name: VK_MEMORY_PROPERTY_HOST_CACHED_BIT
enum.comment: Memory will be cached by the host

enum.name: VK_MEMORY_PROPERTY_LAZILY_ALLOCATED_BIT
enum.comment: Memory may be allocated by the driver when it is required

enum.name: VK_MEMORY_HEAP_DEVICE_LOCAL_BIT
enum.comment: If set, heap represents device memory

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_INDIRECT_COMMAND_READ_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of indirect command reads

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_INDEX_READ_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of index reads

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_VERTEX_ATTRIBUTE_READ_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of vertex attribute reads

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_UNIFORM_READ_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of uniform buffer reads

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_INPUT_ATTACHMENT_READ_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of input attachment reads

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_SHADER_READ_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of shader reads

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_SHADER_WRITE_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of shader writes

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_READ_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of color attachment reads

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_WRITE_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of color attachment writes

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_DEPTH_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT_READ_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of depth/stencil attachment reads

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_DEPTH_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT_WRITE_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of depth/stencil attachment writes

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_TRANSFER_READ_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of transfer reads

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_TRANSFER_WRITE_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of transfer writes

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_HOST_READ_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of host reads

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_HOST_WRITE_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of host writes

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_MEMORY_READ_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of memory reads

enum.name: VK_ACCESS_MEMORY_WRITE_BIT
enum.comment: Controls coherency of memory writes

enum.name: VK_BUFFER_USAGE_TRANSFER_SRC_BIT
enum.comment: Can be used as a source of transfer operations

enum.name: VK_BUFFER_USAGE_TRANSFER_DST_BIT
enum.comment: Can be used as a destination of transfer operations

enum.name: VK_BUFFER_USAGE_UNIFORM_TEXEL_BUFFER_BIT
enum.comment: Can be used as TBO

enum.name: VK_BUFFER_USAGE_STORAGE_TEXEL_BUFFER_BIT
enum.comment: Can be used as IBO

enum.name: VK_BUFFER_USAGE_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BIT
enum.comment: Can be used as UBO

enum.name: VK_BUFFER_USAGE_STORAGE_BUFFER_BIT
enum.comment: Can be used as SSBO

enum.name: VK_BUFFER_USAGE_INDEX_BUFFER_BIT
enum.comment: Can be used as source of fixed-function index fetch (index buffer)

enum.name: VK_BUFFER_USAGE_VERTEX_BUFFER_BIT
enum.comment: Can be used as source of fixed-function vertex fetch (VBO)

enum.name: VK_BUFFER_USAGE_INDIRECT_BUFFER_BIT
enum.comment: Can be the source of indirect parameters (e.g. indirect buffer, parameter buffer)

enum.name: VK_BUFFER_CREATE_SPARSE_BINDING_BIT
enum.comment: Buffer should support sparse backing

enum.name: VK_BUFFER_CREATE_SPARSE_RESIDENCY_BIT
enum.comment: Buffer should support sparse backing with partial residency

enum.name: VK_BUFFER_CREATE_SPARSE_ALIASED_BIT
enum.comment: Buffer should support constent data access to physical memory ranges mapped into multiple locations of sparse buffers

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_USAGE_TRANSFER_SRC_BIT
enum.comment: Can be used as a source of transfer operations

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_USAGE_TRANSFER_DST_BIT
enum.comment: Can be used as a destination of transfer operations

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_USAGE_SAMPLED_BIT
enum.comment: Can be sampled from (SAMPLED_IMAGE and COMBINED_IMAGE_SAMPLER descriptor types)

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_USAGE_STORAGE_BIT
enum.comment: Can be used as storage image (STORAGE_IMAGE descriptor type)

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_USAGE_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_BIT
enum.comment: Can be used as framebuffer color attachment

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_USAGE_DEPTH_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT_BIT
enum.comment: Can be used as framebuffer depth/stencil attachment

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_USAGE_TRANSIENT_ATTACHMENT_BIT
enum.comment: Image data not needed outside of rendering

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_USAGE_INPUT_ATTACHMENT_BIT
enum.comment: Can be used as framebuffer input attachment

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_CREATE_SPARSE_BINDING_BIT
enum.comment: Image should support sparse backing

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_CREATE_SPARSE_RESIDENCY_BIT
enum.comment: Image should support sparse backing with partial residency

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_CREATE_SPARSE_ALIASED_BIT
enum.comment: Image should support constent data access to physical memory ranges mapped into multiple locations of sparse images

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_CREATE_MUTABLE_FORMAT_BIT
enum.comment: Allows image views to have different format than the base image

enum.name: VK_IMAGE_CREATE_CUBE_COMPATIBLE_BIT
enum.comment: Allows creating image views with cube type from the created image

enum.name: VK_FORMAT_FEATURE_SAMPLED_IMAGE_BIT
enum.comment: Format can be used for sampled images (SAMPLED_IMAGE and COMBINED_IMAGE_SAMPLER descriptor types)

enum.name: VK_FORMAT_FEATURE_STORAGE_IMAGE_BIT
enum.comment: Format can be used for storage images (STORAGE_IMAGE descriptor type)

enum.name: VK_FORMAT_FEATURE_STORAGE_IMAGE_ATOMIC_BIT
enum.comment: Format supports atomic operations in case it is used for storage images

enum.name: VK_FORMAT_FEATURE_UNIFORM_TEXEL_BUFFER_BIT
enum.comment: Format can be used for uniform texel buffers (TBOs)

enum.name: VK_FORMAT_FEATURE_STORAGE_TEXEL_BUFFER_BIT
enum.comment: Format can be used for storage texel buffers (IBOs)

enum.name: VK_FORMAT_FEATURE_STORAGE_TEXEL_BUFFER_ATOMIC_BIT
enum.comment: Format supports atomic operations in case it is used for storage texel buffers

enum.name: VK_FORMAT_FEATURE_VERTEX_BUFFER_BIT
enum.comment: Format can be used for vertex buffers (VBOs)

enum.name: VK_FORMAT_FEATURE_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_BIT
enum.comment: Format can be used for color attachment images

enum.name: VK_FORMAT_FEATURE_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_BLEND_BIT
enum.comment: Format supports blending in case it is used for color attachment images

enum.name: VK_FORMAT_FEATURE_DEPTH_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT_BIT
enum.comment: Format can be used for depth/stencil attachment images

enum.name: VK_FORMAT_FEATURE_BLIT_SRC_BIT
enum.comment: Format can be used as the source image of blits with vkCmdBlitImage

enum.name: VK_FORMAT_FEATURE_BLIT_DST_BIT
enum.comment: Format can be used as the destination image of blits with vkCmdBlitImage

enum.name: VK_FORMAT_FEATURE_SAMPLED_IMAGE_FILTER_LINEAR_BIT
enum.comment: Format can be filtered with VK_FILTER_LINEAR when being sampled

enum.name: VK_QUERY_CONTROL_PRECISE_BIT
enum.comment: Require precise results to be collected by the query

enum.name: VK_QUERY_RESULT_64_BIT
enum.comment: Results of the queries are written to the destination buffer as 64-bit values

enum.name: VK_QUERY_RESULT_WAIT_BIT
enum.comment: Results of the queries are waited on before proceeding with the result copy

enum.name: VK_QUERY_RESULT_WITH_AVAILABILITY_BIT
enum.comment: Besides the results of the query, the availability of the results is also written

enum.name: VK_QUERY_RESULT_PARTIAL_BIT
enum.comment: Copy the partial results of the query even if the final results are not available

enum.name: VK_COMMAND_BUFFER_USAGE_SIMULTANEOUS_USE_BIT
enum.comment: Command buffer may be submitted/executed more than once simultaneously

enum.name: VK_SPARSE_IMAGE_FORMAT_SINGLE_MIPTAIL_BIT
enum.comment: Image uses a single mip tail region for all array layers

enum.name: VK_SPARSE_IMAGE_FORMAT_ALIGNED_MIP_SIZE_BIT
enum.comment: Image requires mip level dimensions to be an integer multiple of the sparse image block dimensions for non-tail mip levels.

enum.name: VK_SPARSE_IMAGE_FORMAT_NONSTANDARD_BLOCK_SIZE_BIT
enum.comment: Image uses a non-standard sparse image block dimensions

enum.name: VK_SPARSE_MEMORY_BIND_METADATA_BIT
enum.comment: Operation binds resource metadata to memory

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_TOP_OF_PIPE_BIT
enum.comment: Before subsequent commands are processed

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_DRAW_INDIRECT_BIT
enum.comment: Draw/DispatchIndirect command fetch

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_VERTEX_INPUT_BIT
enum.comment: Vertex/index fetch

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_VERTEX_SHADER_BIT
enum.comment: Vertex shading

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_TESSELLATION_CONTROL_SHADER_BIT
enum.comment: Tessellation control shading

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_TESSELLATION_EVALUATION_SHADER_BIT
enum.comment: Tessellation evaluation shading

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_GEOMETRY_SHADER_BIT
enum.comment: Geometry shading

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_FRAGMENT_SHADER_BIT
enum.comment: Fragment shading

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_EARLY_FRAGMENT_TESTS_BIT
enum.comment: Early fragment (depth and stencil) tests

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_LATE_FRAGMENT_TESTS_BIT
enum.comment: Late fragment (depth and stencil) tests

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_OUTPUT_BIT
enum.comment: Color attachment writes

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_COMPUTE_SHADER_BIT
enum.comment: Compute shading

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_TRANSFER_BIT
enum.comment: Transfer/copy operations

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_BOTTOM_OF_PIPE_BIT
enum.comment: After previous commands have completed

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_HOST_BIT
enum.comment: Indicates host (CPU) is a source/sink of the dependency

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_ALL_GRAPHICS_BIT
enum.comment: All stages of the graphics pipeline

enum.name: VK_PIPELINE_STAGE_ALL_COMMANDS_BIT
enum.comment: All stages supported on the queue

enum.name: VK_COMMAND_POOL_CREATE_TRANSIENT_BIT
enum.comment: Command buffers have a short lifetime

enum.name: VK_COMMAND_POOL_CREATE_RESET_COMMAND_BUFFER_BIT
enum.comment: Command buffers may release their memory individually

enum.name: VK_COMMAND_POOL_RESET_RELEASE_RESOURCES_BIT
enum.comment: Release resources owned by the pool

enum.name: VK_COMMAND_BUFFER_RESET_RELEASE_RESOURCES_BIT
enum.comment: Release resources owned by the buffer

enum.name: VK_SAMPLE_COUNT_1_BIT
enum.comment: Sample count 1 supported

enum.name: VK_SAMPLE_COUNT_2_BIT
enum.comment: Sample count 2 supported

enum.name: VK_SAMPLE_COUNT_4_BIT
enum.comment: Sample count 4 supported

enum.name: VK_SAMPLE_COUNT_8_BIT
enum.comment: Sample count 8 supported

enum.name: VK_SAMPLE_COUNT_16_BIT
enum.comment: Sample count 16 supported

enum.name: VK_SAMPLE_COUNT_32_BIT
enum.comment: Sample count 32 supported

enum.name: VK_SAMPLE_COUNT_64_BIT
enum.comment: Sample count 64 supported

enum.name: VK_ATTACHMENT_DESCRIPTION_MAY_ALIAS_BIT
enum.comment: The attachment may alias physical memory of another attachment in the same render pass

enum.name: VK_STENCIL_FACE_FRONT_BIT
enum.comment: Front face

enum.name: VK_STENCIL_FACE_BACK_BIT
enum.comment: Back face

enum.name: VK_STENCIL_FRONT_AND_BACK
enum.comment: Front and back faces

enum.name: VK_DESCRIPTOR_POOL_CREATE_FREE_DESCRIPTOR_SET_BIT
enum.comment: Descriptor sets may be freed individually

enum.name: VK_DEPENDENCY_BY_REGION_BIT
enum.comment: Dependency is per pixel region

implicitexternsyncparams.param: all sname:VkQueue objects created from pname:device
any sname:VkDescriptorSet objects allocated from pname:descriptorPool
the sname:VkCommandPool that pname:commandBuffer was allocated from
the sname:VkCommandPool that pname:commandBuffer was allocated from

require.comment: Sparse resource memory management API commands
Types not directly used by the API

enum.name: VK_SAMPLER_ADDRESS_MODE_MIRROR_CLAMP_TO_EDGE
enum.comment: Note that this defines what was previously a core enum, and so uses the 'value' attribute rather than 'offset', and does not have a suffix. This is a special case, and should not be repeated

enum.name: VK_FORMAT_FEATURE_SAMPLED_IMAGE_FILTER_CUBIC_BIT_IMG
enum.comment: Format can be filtered with VK_FILTER_CUBIC_IMG when being sampled
